params.name: schedulesInfo
params.doc:
List of schedules to be assigned for the created resource. Currently only a single schedule is allowed.
 If provided, any schedules in the resource entity will be ignored.

description: The `createResource()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a resource object when a resource is created.<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

Resources are created with a schedule. The schedule and its sessions determine the resource's availability. The schedule must contain start date in the `availability.start` property. If the resource is available during the business's default hours, the business's schedule is added as a linked schedule in the resource's schedule. If the resource has its own custom hours, create recurring sessions using the resource's `scheduleId` and set the session type to `"WORING_HOURS"`. Recurring sessions are used to define resource availability. Do not use availability constraints for resource schedules.
<!--ONLY:VELO The sequence for creating a resource is as follows:

1. Create the resource using `createResource()` including schedule information. If the resource uses the default business hours, get the business resource's schedule ID  and include it in the linkedSchedules array in the availability object in the schedule parameters.
1. If the resource has its own schedule, create recurring sessions of type `"WORING_HOURS"` using `createSession()` with the `scheduleId` returned from `createResource()`.
>**Note:** A resource can only have one schedule.

params.name: resourceId
params.doc: ID of the resource to delete.

description: <!--ONLY:VELO The `deleteResource()` function returns a promise that is resolved when a resource is deleted.
Deleting a resource updates its `status` to `"DELETED"` and updates its schedule to `"CANCELED"`.
You can not delete a resource if it has booked sessions.
The Bookings app creates a resource with a name and a tag of "business". This resource is used for the business's schedule and working hours and cannot be deleted.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of the resources according to the provided filters and paging.
description: This query is optional. If no query is provided than all non-deleted resources are returned.
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar, Read Bookings - Public Data, Read Bookings - Including Participants or Manage Bookings permission scope.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of the resources according to the provided filters and paging.
description: This query is optional. If no query is provided than all non-deleted resources are returned.
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar, Read Bookings - Public Data, Read Bookings - Including Participants or Manage Bookings permission scope.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of the resources according to the specified filters and paging.
description: This query is optional. If no query is provided than all non-deleted resources are returned.
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar, Read Bookings - Public Data, Read Bookings - Including Participants or Manage Bookings permission scope. <!--END:ONLY:REST-->

ret.doc:
Contains functionality for refining a bookings query.
The `BookingsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to run, sort, filter, and control
which results a query returns.

Typically, you build a query using any of the bookings query functions,
refine the query by chaining `BookingsQueryBuilder` functions, and then execute the
query by chaining the [`find()`](#find) function.

For example, the following code queries...:

```javascript
import wixBookingsBackend from 'wix-bookings-backend';

wixBookingsBackend.queryBookings()
  .eq("<property1>", "<value1>")
  .ascending("<property2>")
  .limit(5)
  .find()
  .then( (results) => {
    console.log(results.items);
  } );
```

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of the resources according to the provided filters and paging.
description: This query is optional. If no query is provided than all non-deleted resources are returned.
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar, Read Bookings - Public Data, Read Bookings - Including Participants or Manage Bookings permission scope.
The `updateResource()` function returns a promise that resolved to a resource object when a resource is updated.
Use this function to update resource information, add, delete, and update the resource's schedules.
> **Note:** A resource can only have one schedule.
## Updating resources from default business hours to custom hours
+ Update the resource's schedule to remove the business's scheduleId from the `availability.likedSchedules` array.
+ Create a set of recurring sessions of type `"WORKING_HOURS"` to define the resource's new hours.
+ Update the resource's schedule to remove the business's scheduleId from the `a1vailability.likedSchedules` array.
+ Use [`createSession()`](wix-bookings-backend/schedules-obj/createsession) to create a set of recurring sessions of type `"//WORING_HOURS"` to define the resource's new hours.
## Updating resources from custom hours to default business hours
+ Delete the resource's recurring sessions of type `"WORING_HOURS"`
+ Update the resource's schedule to add the business's scheduleId to the `availability.likedSchedules` array.
+ Use [`deleteSession()`](wix-bookings-backend/schedules-obj/deletesession) to delete the recurring sessions of type `"//WORING_HOURS"`
+ Update the resource's schedule to add the business's scheduleId to the `availability.likedSchedules` array.
<!--TODO: link to update schedule for explanation of the schedule side)-->
>**Note:** When updating a resource's schedule you cannot change the resource tag used by the Wix Bookings app. Tags used by the app have the values `"INDIVIDUAL"`, `"GROUP"`, and `"COURSE”`.
>**Note:** When updating a resource's schedule you cannot change the resource tags used by the Wix Bookings app. Tags used by the app have the values `"INDIVIDUAL"`, `"GROUP"`, and `"COURSE”`.

docs.summary: An object describing how to calculate the schedule's availability.
description: An empty object indicates that the schedule is not available for booking.

members.name: start
members.doc: Date and time the schedule starts to be available for booking.

members.name: linkedSchedules
members.doc: Other schedules that impact the availability calculation. Relevant only when there are availability constraints.

members.name: resources

members.name: filter
members.doc: A filter object.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort object in the form `[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.
